programme.title: The Rage: Carrie 2, (1999, Horror)
programme.desc: After her best friend commits suicide, an unpopular girl (Emily Bergl) discovers she has telekinetic powers and uses them to seek revenge on her humiliators.

programme.title: Better Man, (2024, Drama)
programme.desc: The true story of the meteoric rise, dramatic fall, and remarkable resurgence of British pop superstar Robbie Williams.

programme.title: The Importance of Being Earnest, (2002, Comedy)
programme.desc: Complications arise after two bachelors (Rupert Everett, Colin Firth) make use of the same pseudonym in 19th-century England.

programme.title: Fame, (2009, Drama)
programme.desc: Students (Asher Book, Kristy Flores, Paul Iacono) at New York's High School of Performing Arts see if they have the dedication and talent necessary to achieve their dreams.

programme.title: Me Before You, (2016, Romance)
programme.desc: A paralyzed man (Sam Claflin) gets a new lease on life when a cheerful young woman (Emilia Clarke) becomes his caregiver.

programme.title: Cinema Paradiso, (1988, Drama)
programme.desc: A Sicilian boy (Salvatore Cascio) discovers the movies with his local theater's projectionist (Philippe Noiret).

programme.title: An Officer and a Gentleman, (1982, Drama)
programme.desc: A hardened loner (Richard Gere) shapes up for a military drill instructor (Louis Gossett Jr.) and a factory girl (Debra Winger) from town.

programme.title: Chocolat, (2000, Drama)
programme.desc: The mayor opposes a single mother (Juliette Binoche) who is opening a chocolate shop in his 1950s French village across from a church during Lent.

programme.title: Sense and Sensibility, (1995, Romance)
programme.desc: Suitors romance, then abandon, sisters (Emma Thompson, Kate Winslet) left destitute by their father's death in late-1800s England.

programme.title: Pride & Prejudice, (2005, Drama)
programme.desc: A convoluted courtship begins between a young woman (Keira Knightley) and the handsome friend (Matthew Macfadyen) of a wealthy bachelor.

programme.title: The Cider House Rules, (1999, Drama)
programme.desc: Raised to be an obstetrician at a Maine orphanage, a young man (Tobey Maguire) leaves to work at a cider mill with a soldier's beloved (Charlize Theron).

programme.title: Let the Devil In
programme.desc: The town of Jefferson faces a mystery; how does a son murder his mother so brutally and die by suicide in such a seemingly impossible way?; as investigators uncover an obsession with Satan, whispers of demonic possession grow.

programme.title: Mr. Holmes, (2015, Mystery)
programme.desc: Long-retired and near the end of his life, Sherlock Holmes (Ian McKellen) grapples with an unreliable memory and must rely on his housekeeper's son as he revisits the still-unsolved case that led to his retirement.

programme.title: Quigley Down Under, (1990, Western)
programme.desc: An Old West sharpshooter goes to Australia, where his new boss expects him to kill Aboriginal Australians.

programme.title: 12 Angry Men, (1957, Drama)
programme.desc: One (Henry Fonda) of 12 jurors holds out in the case of a boy from the slums who is accused of killing his father.

programme.title: Our Kind of Traitor, (2016, Thriller)
programme.desc: A money launderer (Stellan Skarsgard) for Russian gangsters asks a couple vacationing in Marrakech, Morocco, to deliver incriminating evidence to an MI6 agent (Damian Lewis).

programme.title: Bones and All, (2022, Romance)
programme.desc: Love blossoms between a young woman on the margins of society and a disenfranchised drifter as they embark on a 3,000-mile odyssey through the backroads of America.

programme.title: Into the Wild, (2007, Drama)
programme.desc: A top student and athlete leaves his middle-class life to venture into Alaska, only to meet people who will eventually shape his values and life.

programme.title: The Last Castle, (2001, Thriller)
programme.desc: A court-martialed general (Robert Redford) leads a revolt against a corrupt warden (James Gandolfini) in a military prison.

programme.title: Enemy at the Gates, (2001, War)
programme.desc: A Nazi sniper (Ed Harris) travels to Stalingrad to find and kill a Russian sharpshooter (Jude Law), the hero of the propaganda campaign of a political officer (Joseph Fiennes).

programme.title: Jack Reacher: Never Go Back, (2016, Action)
programme.desc: Investigator Jack Reacher (Tom Cruise) goes on the lam to uncover the truth behind a major government conspiracy that involves the death of U.S. soldiers.

programme.title: Novocaine, (2025, Action)
programme.desc: When the girl of his dreams gets kidnapped, a man turns his inability to feel pain into an unexpected advantage. He fights a bunch of thugs to get her back.

programme.title: Ronin, (1998, Action)
programme.desc: An Irish ringleader (Natascha McElhone) organizes an international team of hired guns (Robert De Niro, Jean Reno) to retrieve a briefcase from criminals.

programme.title: The Delta Force, (1986, Action)
programme.desc: Terrorists reroute a passenger jet from Athens to Beirut, where commandos (Chuck Norris, Lee Marvin) are waiting to negotiate.

programme.title: Catch-22, (1970, Comedy)
programme.desc: Air Force officers try to cope with the insanity of World War II in this adaptation of Joseph Heller's novel.

programme.title: Max 2: White House Hero, (2017, Children)
programme.desc: Max, a military service dog, is assigned to serve on the U.S. president's Secret Service detail.

programme.title: Where to Invade Next, (2015, Comedy)
programme.desc: Filmmaker Michael Moore visits various countries, including France, Italy, Germany, Finland and Slovenia, to examine how Europeans view work, education, health care, sex, equality, and other issues.

programme.title: Nickel Boys, (2024, Drama)
programme.desc: Elwood Curtis' college dreams are shattered when he's sentenced to a brutal reformatory in the Jim Crow South. Clinging to his optimistic worldview, Elwood strikes up a friendship with a fellow Black teen who dispenses fundamental tips for survival.

programme.title: Thelma & Louise, (1991, Adventure)
programme.desc: An Arkansas waitress (Susan Sarandon) and a housewife (Geena Davis) shoot a rapist and take off in a '66 Thunderbird.

programme.title: Blink Twice, (2024, Thriller)
programme.desc: When tech billionaire Slater King meets Frida, he invites her to join him and his friends for a dream vacation on his private island. However, when strange things start to happen, she'll have to uncover the truth if she hopes to make it out alive.

programme.title: Gorky Park, (1983, Thriller)
programme.desc: A Moscow detective's investigation of a bizarre triple murder leads him to run-ins with the KGB and an American tycoon.

programme.title: Witness, (1985, Crime Story)
programme.desc: An eight-year-old Amish boy witnesses a drug-related murder in a Philadelphia train station. The Philadelphia police captain discovers that the murderers are cops trying to squelch a corruption investigation.

programme.title: Murder on the Orient Express, (1974, Mystery)
programme.desc: Belgian sleuth Hercule Poirot investigates an American industrialist's murder aboard the world-famous luxury train.

programme.title: Three Days of the Condor, (1975, Thriller)
programme.desc: A CIA bookworm (Robert Redford) reports mayhem to his boss (Cliff Robertson), then hides out with a woman (Faye Dunaway) and sees a conspiracy.

programme.title: Gone Girl, (2014, Mystery)
programme.desc: A man reports that his wife has gone missing on their fifth wedding anniversary, but his public portrait of their blissful union begins to crumble under police pressure and a growing media frenzy.

programme.title: Let the Devil In
programme.desc: The town of Jefferson faces a mystery; how does a son murder his mother so brutally and die by suicide in such a seemingly impossible way?; as investigators uncover an obsession with Satan, whispers of demonic possession grow.

programme.title: Torn Hearts, (2022, Horror)
programme.desc: A country music duo seek out the private mansion of their idol and end up in a twisted series of horrors that force them to confront the limits they'd go for their dreams.

programme.title: Unprotected Sets
programme.desc: Seaton Smith performs a set loaded with relationship advice and "white positive" jokes; Yedoye Travis also covers race relations while making the argument that the devil is actually white.

programme.title: The Misfits, (1961, Western)
programme.desc: A divorcee (Marilyn Monroe) joins an old cowboy (Clark Gable) and his partners rounding up wild horses for dog food.

programme.title: Tommy's Honour, (2016, History)
programme.desc: Tom and Tommy Morris, father and son pioneers of professional golf, relied on skill, business acumen and working-class street smarts to make Tommy one of the world's first sports superstars and found the modern game of golf.

programme.title: Snack Shack, (2024, Drama)
programme.desc: Best friends AJ and Moose seize the opportunity to run the local pool's rundown snack shack. However, things take an unexpected turn when they meet Brooke, an effortlessly cool lifeguard who puts their big summer plans -- and friendship -- at risk.

programme.title: Escape From Alcatraz, (1979, Thriller)
programme.desc: A hardened con with a history of prison breaks, is sent to serve the rest of his life sentence at Alcatraz, America's most infamously brutal and inescapable maximum security prison.

programme.title: Missing in Action, (1984, War)
programme.desc: A U.S. colonel (Chuck Norris) escapes from the Viet Cong, then comes back with a floating arsenal to get others out.

programme.title: Missing in Action 2: The Beginning, (1985, War)
programme.desc: An imprisoned U.S. colonel (Chuck Norris) fights the military overlord (Oh Soon-tek) of a slave-labor opium operation in Vietnam.

programme.title: The Patriot, (2000, War)
programme.desc: A pacifist farmer (Mel Gibson) of South Carolina reluctantly joins the Revolutionary War and fights alongside his son (Heath Ledger).

programme.title: Air Force One, (1997, Thriller)
programme.desc: Demanding the release of a political prisoner, a terrorist and his gang hijack the U.S. president's plane.

programme.title: A Working Man, (2025, Action)
programme.desc: Levon Cade left behind a military career in the black ops to live a simple life. However, when human traffickers kidnap his boss's daughter, his search to bring her home uncovers a world of corruption far greater than he ever could have imagined.

programme.title: Black Hawk Down, (2001, War)
programme.desc: U.S. soldiers encounter heavy fire while trying to capture a warlord's associates in Mogadishu, Somalia.

programme.title: A House on the Bayou: Trailer, (2021, Horror)
programme.desc: A troubled couple and their teenage daughter go on vacation to an isolated house in the Louisiana bayou to reconnect as a family. When unexpected visitors arrive, their facade of family unity starts to unravel, as terrifying secrets come to light.

programme.title: Carrie, (1976, Horror)
programme.desc: A social misfit (Sissy Spacek) with psychic powers wreaks havoc at her prom to get even with pranksters.

programme.title: 1984, (1984, Science fiction)
programme.desc: Orwell's Big Brother is watching as Winston Smith (John Hurt) and his lover (Suzanna Hamilton) defy authority in bleak Oceania.

programme.title: The Nutty Professor, (1963, Comedy)
programme.desc: Goofy professor Kelp's potion turns him into Buddy Love, a lounge singer at ease with a coed and a crowd.

programme.title: The Man in the Moon, (1991, Drama)
programme.desc: A couple's (Sam Waterston, Tess Harper) two daughters catch the eye of their new teenage neighbor in 1957 Louisiana.

programme.title: Into the Wild, (2007, Drama)
programme.desc: A top student and athlete leaves his middle-class life to venture into Alaska, only to meet people who will eventually shape his values and life.

programme.title: A River Runs Through It, (1992, Drama)
programme.desc: Two Montana boys become different men (Craig Sheffer, Brad Pitt) under the influence of fly-fishing and their minister father (Tom Skerritt).

programme.title: Thelma & Louise, (1991, Adventure)
programme.desc: An Arkansas waitress (Susan Sarandon) and a housewife (Geena Davis) shoot a rapist and take off in a '66 Thunderbird.

programme.title: Orange County, (2002, Comedy)
programme.desc: A high schooler (Colin Hanks) tries to fix a mistake after his guidance counselor sends the wrong papers to Stanford University.

programme.title: Hot Tub Time Machine, (2010, Comedy)
programme.desc: Following a night of drinking in a ski-resort hot tub, four pals awake in 1986, getting a chance to rewrite the past.

programme.title: Galaxy Quest, (1999, Comedy)
programme.desc: Aliens, believing actors to be real heroes, enlist cast members of a sci-fi TV series to help save their people.

programme.title: Bill & Ted's Excellent Adventure, (1989, Comedy)
programme.desc: Two dopey dudes (Keanu Reeves, Alex Winter) go back in time to fetch Beethoven, Napoleon and other biggies for a history project.

programme.title: Bill & Ted's Bogus Journey, (1991, Comedy)
programme.desc: The dopey dudes (Keanu Reeves, Alex Winter) beat the Grim Reaper (William Sadler) in a board-game contest, so he must help them stop their evil robot twins.

programme.title: Bill & Ted Face the Music, (2020, Comedy)
programme.desc: The ruler of the future tells best friends Bill and Ted they must compose a new song to save life as we know it. But instead of writing it, they decide to travel through time to steal it from their older selves and bring harmony to the universe.

programme.title: Hot Tub Time Machine, (2010, Comedy)
programme.desc: Following a night of drinking in a ski-resort hot tub, four pals awake in 1986, getting a chance to rewrite the past.

programme.title: The High and the Mighty, (1954, Thriller)
programme.desc: On a flight from Hawaii to California, the engine dies on the plane Dan is flying. As he prepares for a crash landing, the passengers reassess their lives.

programme.title: Stargate: The Ark of Truth, (2008, Science fiction)
programme.desc: An old enemy helps the crew of SG-1 search for an ancient device that can end the war.

programme.title: Stargate: Continuum, (2008, Science fiction)
programme.desc: The crew (Ben Browder, Michael Shanks, Amanda Tapping) of SG-1 battles an adversary (Cliff Simon) who alters the history of the Stargate.

programme.title: WarGames, (1983, Thriller)
programme.desc: A teen taps his computer into the NORAD missile-defense system and plays a video game, "Global Thermonuclear War.".

programme.title: Galaxy Quest, (1999, Comedy)
programme.desc: Aliens, believing actors to be real heroes, enlist cast members of a sci-fi TV series to help save their people.

programme.title: Bill & Ted's Excellent Adventure, (1989, Comedy)
programme.desc: Two dopey dudes (Keanu Reeves, Alex Winter) go back in time to fetch Beethoven, Napoleon and other biggies for a history project.

programme.title: Bill & Ted's Bogus Journey, (1991, Comedy)
programme.desc: The dopey dudes (Keanu Reeves, Alex Winter) beat the Grim Reaper (William Sadler) in a board-game contest, so he must help them stop their evil robot twins.

programme.title: Fargo, (1996, Thriller)
programme.desc: A pregnant police chief (Frances McDormand) probes the murderous events that evolved from a desperate car salesman's (William H. Macy) kidnapping scheme.

programme.title: The Golden Child, (1986, Comedy)
programme.desc: A professional child-finder (Eddie Murphy) is recruited to rescue a mystical Tibetan boy from a shape-shifting villain (Charles Dance).

programme.title: Pain & Gain, (2013, Action)
programme.desc: In 1990s Miami, a gym manager (Mark Wahlberg) and his muscular accomplices (Dwayne Johnson, Anthony Mackie) kidnap a wealthy businessman and force him to sign over all his assets -- including cars and a luxurious mansion -- to them.

programme.title: Be Cool, (2005, Comedy)
programme.desc: Chili Palmer (John Travolta) runs afoul of music-industry players when he teams up with a friend's widow (Uma Thurman) to produce a singer's debut album.

programme.title: The Wolf of Wall Street, (2013, Comedy)
programme.desc: New York stockbroker Jordan Belfort, who founded brokerage firm Stratton Oakmont while still in his early 20s, develops habits of wretched excess and corruption.

programme.title: Everything You Always Wanted to Know About Sex (But Were Afraid to Ask), (1972, Comedy)
programme.desc: Questions from Dr. David Reuben's sex manual are answered in seven comic sketches, concerning subjects from aphrodisiacs to male anatomy.

programme.title: The Golden Child, (1986, Comedy)
programme.desc: A professional child-finder (Eddie Murphy) is recruited to rescue a mystical Tibetan boy from a shape-shifting villain (Charles Dance).

programme.title: Cyrano, (2021, Musical)
programme.desc: Cyrano de Bergerac dazzles everyone with his ferocious wordplay and brilliant swordplay. However, he's convinced his appearance renders him unworthy of the affections of the luminous Roxanne, a devoted friend who's in love with someone else.

programme.title: The Time Machine, (2002, Science fiction)
programme.desc: A scientist (Guy Pearce) travels into the future and meets a race of people who fear hideous monsters living under the ground.

programme.title: Face/Off, (1997, Action)
programme.desc: An FBI agent (John Travolta) and his nemesis (Nicolas Cage) trade physical identities.

programme.title: Be Cool, (2005, Comedy)
programme.desc: Chili Palmer (John Travolta) runs afoul of music-industry players when he teams up with a friend's widow (Uma Thurman) to produce a singer's debut album.

programme.title: Pain & Gain, (2013, Action)
programme.desc: In 1990s Miami, a gym manager (Mark Wahlberg) and his muscular accomplices (Dwayne Johnson, Anthony Mackie) kidnap a wealthy businessman and force him to sign over all his assets -- including cars and a luxurious mansion -- to them.

programme.title: The Perfect Match, (2016, Romance)
programme.desc: Complications arise when a lifelong playboy (Terrence J) bets his friends that he can date the same woman (Cassie Ventura) for one month without falling in love.

programme.title: Beauty Shop, (2005, Comedy)
programme.desc: After a falling-out with an overbearing employer, reputed hairstylist Gina decides to go independent. Soon enough, she opens the doors of her new salon to an amusing crowd of patrons.

programme.title: The Wood, (1999, Drama)
programme.desc: Young men (Omar Epps, Taye Diggs, Richard T. Jones), one of whom is about to be married, reminisce about their childhood during the 1980s in Inglewood, Calif.

programme.title: Boomerang, (1992, Comedy)
programme.desc: A Manhattan playboy (Eddie Murphy) gets a new corporate boss (Robin Givens), and she treats him the way he has always treated women.

programme.title: Soul Plane, (2004, Comedy)
programme.desc: Passengers and crew (Kevin Hart, Method Man) enjoy a wild party aboard an airliner flying from Los Angeles to New York.

programme.title: Beauty Shop, (2005, Comedy)
programme.desc: After a falling-out with an overbearing employer, reputed hairstylist Gina decides to go independent. Soon enough, she opens the doors of her new salon to an amusing crowd of patrons.

programme.title: What Women Want, (2000, Romance)
programme.desc: A freak accident gives a Chicago advertising executive (Mel Gibson) the ability to read women's minds.

programme.title: The Cutting Edge: Fire & Ice, (2010, Drama)
programme.desc: A speed skater (Brendan Fehr) persuades a former figure skater (Francia Raisa) to return to the ice as his partner.

programme.title: West Side Story, (1961, Musical)
programme.desc: Against a backdrop of vicious gang warfare between the New Yorker Jets and the Puerto Rican Sharks, a romance develops across rival lines. 1960s update of "Romeo and Juliet", with amazing song and dance sequences.

programme.title: Bull Durham, (1988, Romance)
programme.desc: A literary baseball groupie (Susan Sarandon) romances a pitcher (Tim Robbins) and a catcher (Kevin Costner) on a minor-league North Carolina team.

programme.title: Soul Plane, (2004, Comedy)
programme.desc: Passengers and crew (Kevin Hart, Method Man) enjoy a wild party aboard an airliner flying from Los Angeles to New York.

programme.title: Boomerang, (1992, Comedy)
programme.desc: A Manhattan playboy (Eddie Murphy) gets a new corporate boss (Robin Givens), and she treats him the way he has always treated women.

programme.title: The Wood, (1999, Drama)
programme.desc: Young men (Omar Epps, Taye Diggs, Richard T. Jones), one of whom is about to be married, reminisce about their childhood during the 1980s in Inglewood, Calif.

programme.title: Child's Play, (1988, Horror)
programme.desc: A struggling single mother unknowingly gifts her son a doll imbued with a serial killer's consciousness.

programme.title: Flatliners, (1990, Science fiction)
programme.desc: Medical students (Kiefer Sutherland, Julia Roberts, Kevin Bacon) play with death by stopping one another's vital signs for minutes, then zapping the subject back to consciousness.

programme.title: The Haunting, (1999, Horror)
programme.desc: A parapsychologist and three others stay in a house reputed to be the site of many awful tragedies and paranormal events.

However, when Robyn goes to the restroom and doesn't return, Wayne's worst fear is confirmed when he realizes she's been kidnapped. On a mission to find her in a stadium filled with thousands of people, he races against the clock and will stop at nothing to find her before it is too late.

programme.title: Fera Da Neve, (2011, Creature Features)

programme.title: Pnico a Bordo, (2006, Creature Features)
programme.desc: Sob uma poderosa maldio maia, as cobras nascem dentro de uma jovem, devorando-a lentamente por dentro. Sua nica chance de sobrevivncia um xam poderoso que vive do outro lado da fronteira.

programme.title: Mortos Vivos, (2020, Zombies)

programme.desc: In the midst of the Hundred Years' War, the young King Henry V of England embarks on the conquest of France in 1415.

programme.title: Windtalkers, (2002, Drama)

programme.desc: Yugi gives up one of his own Star Chips so Joey can board the boat bound for Duelist Kingdom and duel to save his sister's eyesight. Meanwhile, the cheat Weevil tries to cripple Yugi's deck by tossing his best cards overboard!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Pegasus announces that there are many strange secrets that will make his ultimate tournament unlike any they've ever had. Yugi must not only figure the rules out, but master them if he's to survive!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: After Yugi defeats Weevil's first wave of Duel Monsters, he's shocked to discover that Weevil has one last trick up his sleeve; a ravenous Great Moth that grows in power with every turn!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Joey finds himself courageously accepting a challenge from veteran duelist, Mai. But when Mai begins to demonstrate an unnerving psychic ability, Joey has to figure out Mai's secret strategy before falling victim to it!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: The fisherman duelist baits Yugi into a duel on his own sea playing field for a home-field advantage. Can Yugi adapt to these new settings to turn the tide of battle?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: If Yugi is eliminated from the tournament, KaibaCorp's crooked Board of Directors will transfer control of the company from Kaiba to Pegasus! Kaiba's brother Mokuba challenges Yugi to a duel to protect his brother's company!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Yugi must duel a magical doppelganger of Kaiba, created from the greed and power lust Yugi wiped from Kaiba's soul.

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Yugi defeats the Blue Eyes White Dragon, but there are two more waiting in the wings! Will the real Kaiba reach Yugi in time to help beat this impersonator?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Joey decides to battle Rex Raptor without his friends' help to prove that he is man enough to take care of Serenity on his own.

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Joey duels valiantly, but Rex Raptor has unleashed his secret weapon: the Red-Eyes Black Dragon!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Yugi's classmate Bakura, possessed by his Millennium Ring's dark powers, traps Yugi and friends in a Shadow Game where they become the cards themselves!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Pegasus's hired duelist Panik cheats Mai of all her star chips, and Yugi vows to defeat him and win them back. But when Panik's Castle of Dark Illusions enshrouds his monsters in a black mist, how can Yugi defeat an enemy he cannot see?
programme.sub-title: The Light at the End of the Tunnel

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Despite his astonishing disadvantage, Yugi boldly provokes Panik - "I'll finish you in three turns." Is Yugi bluffing, or does he have the advantage in this battle of wits?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Kaiba descends to the kingdom to face Pegasus. Has Kaiba changed since his battle with Yugi, or is he still the same merciless duelist? A battle between Kaiba's Blue Eyes White Dragon and Joey's Red Eyes Black Dragon holds the answers!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Bandit Keith's gang kidnaps Joey to a secret cave with a graveyard playing field. As Yugi and friends search for him, Joey faces Bandit Keith's zombie monsters which become stronger as they return from the grave!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Joey's last-ditch effort, his lucky Time Wizard card, fails against Bandit Keith's zombie monsters. But as his lucky streak comes to an end, will his improving skills as a duelist and his love for his sister inspire him to victory?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Yugi and Joey band together in a team battle against the Paradox Brothers with all the Star Chips and entrance to Pegasus's castle on the line!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: The Paradox Brothers summon the almighty Gate Guardian, a monster that reflects all attacks! Is Joey helping Yugi in this duel, or is his lack of experience sealing their fate for defeat?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Yugi and Joey each unleash their strongest monster, the Summoned Skull, and the Red-Eyes Black Dragon, but their strength pales in comparison to the tremendous power of the Gate Guardian.

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: In order to earn the right to challenge Pegasus, Kaiba must first beat Yugi and take his Star Chips. The rematch between Yugi and Kaiba is about to begin!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Kaiba summons the Blue-Eyes Ultimate Dragon, the strongest monster in the game fused from three Blue-Eyes White Dragons! Yugi has lost all his powerful Duel Monsters, but a true duelist never gives up!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Yugi begins spinning a strategy to put the Blue-Eyes Ultimate Dragon to rest, but he must decide whether to claim victory or spare Kaiba his life. Yugi's heart is split in two!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Having lost his star chips to Kaiba and his only opportunity to save Grandpa, Yugi is in a state of shock. Can Tea bring Yugi back to consciousness by defeating Mai for her extra star chips and teach Yugi the heart of the duelist?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Yugi and friends enter the castle to discover Kaiba ready to duel Pegasus with Mokuba's soul hanging in the balance! The power of the Millennium Eye gives Pegasus the ability to read other people's minds.

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Kaiba is helpless against Pegasus's Toon World deck and mind-reading abilities. As the duel ends, Pegasus imprisons Kaiba's soul into a card, just like Grandpa and Mokuba!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Yugi vows to overthrow Pegasus for the sake of his Grandpa. Tristan leads an exploration party to uncover Pegasus's secrets. While Joey sleeps, Bandit Keith steals from him the card that permits his entry in the final battle!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Under Pegasus's glare, Yugi is distracted from his duel with Mai. After making foolish errors and allowing Mai to gain a huge advantage with her Harpie's Pet Dragon, will Yugi gather his focus or succumb to the pressure?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Mai has rebounded from her previous loss to Joey to become a better duelist. Has Yugi learned from his loss to Kaiba, or is the emotional defeat still weighing on his heart? The answer is in the cards!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Joey searches for the card that permits him to enter the final battle, not realizing Bandit Keith has stolen it. As he struggles to accept the fact that Serenity will be blind forever, he receives help from a new friend!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: After Bandit Keith's Machine deck forces Joey to take the defensive, Joey mimics Keith's battle strategy to metalize his Red-Eyes Black Dragon! Is victory assured, or does the cheater Bandit Keith literally have one last card up his sleeve?

programme.desc: Joey challenges Yugi for the right to face Pegasus. In a battle between friends, a fierce match ensues between the two people who know each other's strategies and cards.

programme.sub-title: THE TARGET IS CAMIE!! THE LOOMING CLUTCHES OF A PROFESSIONAL KIDNAPPER

programme.title: Camie was abducted by a dastardly gang of kidnappers, and her next stop is the auction house unless the Straw Hats can rescue her. To make it in time, they'll have to hitch a ride on some flying fish!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: RESCUE CAMIE / THE ARCHIPELAGO'S LINGERING DARK HISTORY

programme.title: With a little help from their fishy mates, the Straw Hats make it to the auction house in time to save Camie, but explosive elements prevent them from taking her back by force. Luckily, Nami's concocted a very generous plan!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: TIME LIMIT / THE HUMAN AUCTION BEGINS

programme.title: Nami's plan to save Camie goes belly up when a snot-nosed Celestial Dragon outbids the Straw Hats. Luffy and Zoro make an explosive arrival at the auction house and promptly open up a deadly can of worms.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: THE FIST EXPLODES! DESTROY THE AUCTION

programme.title: Luffy turns a mermaid auction into a pirate-style brawl when he knocks the snot out of a Celestial Dragon. With a fleet of marines out to get them, the Straw Hats will have to fight their way off the island!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: MAJOR PANIC! DESPERATE STRUGGLE AT THE AUCTION HOUSE

programme.title: They saved Camie from the auction block, but now the Straw Hats are surrounded by a fleet of marines. Lucky for Luffy, Eustass "Captain" Kidd and Trafalgar Law are ready to join the fight!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: ADMIRAL KIZARU TAKES ACTION! SABAODY ARCHIPELAGO THROWN INTO CHAOS

programme.title: The Straw Hats join forces with Kidd's crew and Trafalgar's mates to make short work of the marines, but they're in for a surprise when they encounter a Warlord of the Sea!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: BREAK THROUGH THE SIEGE! THE NAVY VS. THE THREE CAPTAINS

programme.title: Luffy and his crew duck the marines by hiding out at Rayleigh's house. While Chopper tends to Hachi, Rayleigh entertains the Straw Hats with tales of his days as first mate on Gold Roger's ship.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: ROGER AND RAYLEIGH - THE KING OF THE PIRATES AND HIS RIGHT HAND MAN

programme.title: Admiral Kizaru has arrived to lead the marines on a mission to wipe out all pirates. Meanwhile, Luffy and his crew prepare for a deadly battle with one of the Warlords of the Sea!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: NO ESCAPE!? ADMIRAL KIZARU'S LIGHT SPEED KICK!!

programme.title: A groovy pirate belts out a tune that leaves Kizaru in pieces, but the admiral pulls himself together in time for a crushing Light Speed Kick. Luffy and Sanji try to protect the injured Zoro from a Warlord lookalike.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: OVERWHELMING! THE NAVY'S FIGHTING WEAPONS, THE PACIFISTAS

programme.title: Luffy and the Straw Hats narrowly defeat a robot that resembles one of the Seven Warlords of the Sea. But before the dust settles on the field of battle, a far deadlier foe comes looking for a fight.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: AN EVEN STRONGER ENEMY APPEARS! THE BATTLE AXE-CARRYING SENTOMARU

programme.title: Zoro's barely breathing, and Admiral Kizaru is ready to stomp him into oblivion. The battered and beaten Straw Hats could certainly use a powerful friend right about now.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: ADMIRAL KIZARU'S FIERCE ASSAULT / THE STRAW HATS FACE CERTAIN DEATH!

programme.title: One by one, the mighty paw-print of Bartholomew Kuma makes the Straw Hats disappear until only Luffy remains. To where did his mates vanish? And will he ever see them again?
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: ELIMINATED FRIENDS - THE FINAL DAY OF THE STRAW HAT CREW

programme.title: Yesterday, the Straw Hats valiantly battled a Warlord of the Sea. Today, Boss Luffy and his friends at the Pinwheel Diner prepare to compete in the Great Portable Shrine Race!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: FEUDAL ERA SIDE STORY / BOSS LUFFY APPEARS AGAIN

programme.title: Thriller Company sabotages the race for a sacred treasure, and the displaced Straw Hats must pull an all-nighter to rebuild their shrine and score some ancient gold!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: FEUDAL ERA SIDE STORY / DEFEAT THRILLER COMPANY'S TRAP!

programme.title: Luffy finds himself stranded and starving on a strange island. The rubber-man's amazing appetite puts his manhood in danger when he devours an array of exotic mushrooms!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: LANDING! THE ALL-FEMALE ISLAND, AMAZON LILY

programme.title: An army of scantily-clad women warriors want to investigate Luffy's family jewels, but the captain of the Straw Hats is more interested in reuniting with his lost mates.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: HURRY BACK TO YOUR FRIENDS! THE MAIDEN ISLAND ADVENTURE

programme.title: The women chasing Luffy are loyal subjects of Boa Hancock, the curvaceous Warlord of the Sea. This stone-cold beauty is deadly, and she's about to pick a fight with an entire fleet of marines!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: EVERYONE FALLS IN LOVE! PIRATE EMPRESS HANCOCK

programme.title: Luffy's search for a seaworthy vessel leads to a "drop-in" on the Snake Princess during the royal bathing hour. The view is world-class, but it might turn the rubber-man to stone!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: THE SECRET HIDDEN ON THE BACKS / LUFFY AND THE SNAKE PRINCESS MEET

programme.title: Boa Hancock makes Luffy mad when she turns Margaret into a statue. The Snake Princess may have bitten off more than she can chew by challenging the captain of the Straw Hats!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: HEARTLESS JUDGMENT! MARGARET IS TURNED TO STONE!!

programme.title: The Snake Princess pits Luffy's Gum-Gum abilities against the incredible Haki power of her serpentine sisters in a fight to the death. Will Luffy survive long enough to save his statuesque friends?
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: A DIFFICULT FIGHT FOR LUFFY! THE SNAKE SISTERS' HAKI POWER!!

programme.title: Luffy kicks his attack mode into Second Gear to save a precious statue, and the snake sisters start to feel the Straw Hat heat. At the battle's climax, Luffy makes an impression on his opponents.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: ALL-OUT SPECIAL POWER BATTLE!! GUM-GUM VS. SNAKE-SNAKE

programme.title: News of Luffy's run-in with the Celestial Dragons impresses the Snake Princess, so she tells him the story of her tortured past. Will his honorable nature speed Luffy toward a reunion with his crew?
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: HANCOCK'S CONFESSION-- THE SISTERS' ABHORRENT PAST

programme.title: Luffy is mobbed by a hoard of pretty Kuja women eager to touch a real live man. Granny Nyon offers him a safe haven, but what she has to say might sink his plans for a Straw Hat reunion.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: SAVING ACE! THE NEXT STOP: THE GREAT PRISON

programme.title: Boa Hancock's illness threatens to sabotage Luffy's rescue mission. However, the Snake Princess just can't say "no" to the rubber-man, so a plan to save Ace is quickly hatched.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: LOVE IS A HURRICANE! LOVE-LOVE HANCOCK

programme.title: While Luffy races to save Ace, Nami tries to survive life on Sky Island, and Franky dances up a snowstorm before making the switch from cola to tea!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: THE FRIENDS' WHEREABOUTS! THE SCIENCE OF WEATHER AND THE MECHANICAL ISLAND

programme.title: Chopper narrowly avoids being served for dinner in a land inhabited by giant birds, and Sanji's refined tastes land him a role as a leading lady on the island of girlish hearts.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: THE FRIENDS' WHEREABOUTS! AN ISLAND OF GIANT BIRDS AND A PINK PARADISE!

programme.title: Nico Robin finds herself trapped on the island of Tequila Wolf: a miserable land where children are forced to work as slaves. Elsewhere, Usopp tries to survive a run-in with a man-eating plant!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: THE FRIENDS' WHEREABOUTS! BRIDGING THE ISLANDS AND VICIOUS VEGETATION!

programme.title: Zoro is held against his will by the pink-haired princess of bad vibes, Brook gets mistaken for the king of darkness, and Luffy continues to eat his way toward a reunion with Fire-Fist Ace!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: THE FRIENDS' WHEREABOUTS! A NEGATIVE PRINCESS AND THE KING OF DEMONS!

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 1
programme.desc: Fujiko goads Lupin into stealing a large shipment of diamonds. Lupin takes the task despite Jigen's protest that Fujiko is playing them for fools. Of course, Jigen is right.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 1
programme.desc: Fujiko invites Lupin and the gang to a famous nightclub owned by the sexy Hoshikage Rinko. Only Goemon refuses. This was a wise move as Rinko places timebombs on Fujiko, Jigen, and Lupin.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 1
programme.desc: Smith is an art thief that is selling stolen paintings under the guise of a beauty contest. Lupin decides he wants in on the action as well, promising to steal away the treasured paintings.
programme.sub-title: Keep an Eye On the Beauty Contest

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 1
programme.desc: Inspector Ganimard III is the grandson of Lupin I's archnemesis. He has come to Japan as the head of security for the 1972 France Fair but also intends to restore his family's honor by arresting Lupin III.
programme.sub-title: Which of the Third Generation Will Win!

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 1
programme.desc: Someone is committing thefts under Lupin's name. Lupin follows the imposters back to their island hideout. He has apparently stumbled into a whole island of thieves.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 1
programme.desc: Rie is being held captive though she does not realize it. She believes the man holding her is a friend of her father, Ken Makita. Lupin shows up to rescue her.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 1
programme.desc: Gordon, an FBI computer specialist, is in Japan to operate a computer capable of predicting crimes and determining how to stop them. The Metropolitan Police Department hopes that this will finally help them capture Lupin.
programme.sub-title: The First Move Wins Computer Operation!

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Part 1
programme.desc: A disputed horde of recently discovered ancient gold coins draws the attention of Lupin and company. As the ownership of the coins is disputed, Lupin decides to settle the matter on his own by stealing them from the Dai Nippon Bank.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Bye Bye, Lady Liberty
programme.desc: Foiled repeatedly by the predictions of Interpol's supercomputer, professional looter Lupin III has settled down. A sinister secret organization and a young computer genius are thrown into the mix. And whose side is the buxom Fujiko on this time?

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: The Hemingway Papers
programme.desc: The legendary last manuscript of the great Ernest Hemingway tells of a buried treasure on an island far away and thief extraordinaire Lupin is on the trail! But he gets caught up in a local civil war, Lupin will have to keep his wits or risk his life!

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: Napoleon's Dictionary
programme.desc: Lupin learns of his grandfather's secret treasure, supposedly hidden in the pages of a dictionary previously owned by Napoleon Bonaparte! Said dictionary just happens to be the prize in a cross-country classic car race.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd: From Siberia With Love
programme.desc: Ultimate thief Lupin III has a new target: the lost gold of the Romanov dynasty! With the help of a mysterious blonde named Judy Scott, Lupin discovers the treasure hidden in Texas, at the Bank of Liberty.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: It's been a long time since Jigen, Goemon and Fujiko have heard from Lupin. Then one day, they each receive an invitation from Lupin for a reunion aboard the luxury liner Sirloin.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: An international soccer game is taking place in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil and Lupin has his eyes on the box office and betting takes. Will the box office heist go as planned?
programme.sub-title: Wads of Bills Blossomed in the Sunset of Rio

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: An old man who supposedly knows the secret to Hitler's legacy lives in East Germany within the Berlin Wall. Lupin and his gang track the old man down, but the old man can't recall anything about any legacy.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: At Loch Ness in Scotland, the mysterious monster Nessie reveals itself from the lake, charmed by Fujiko's singing. Seeing this, Doctor Oz decides to use Fujiko to capture Nessie for his personal gain.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Fujiko and a mystery man have an enticing job for Lupin: Stealing a ton of gold bullion from a Swiss Bank, a bank renowned for its tight security. Can it be done? What is the mystery man's true identity?
programme.sub-title: I'll Teach You How to Transport Gold Bars

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: A man is threatening to destroy the Leaning Tower of Pisa with a device that generates artificial earthquakes. The Italian government has no choice but to meet the culprit's, but Lupin takes the ransom for himself!
programme.sub-title: Will the Leaving Tower of Pisa Be Standing?

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin has stolen the golden death mask of Tutankhamen, the ancient Egyptian pharaoh known as the "boy king." However, when Lupin tries on the golden death mask he becomes possessed by an ominous curse.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: The Trans Europe Superexpress train has departed Venice and is headed to France. Onboard the Superexpress is crime boss Don Marcino's ill-gotten treasures. Can Lupin and his gang pull off the heist before the train reaches its destination?

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin meets the grandson of master Ukiyoe artist, Toushusai Sharaku and learns that he has been switching his own works with his grandfather's originals. Unable to switch the last painting due to illness, he asks Lupin to switch it in his stead.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin and Fujiko have been invited to a party hosted by Marcel Dulane, a member of Paris' high society. However, the elegant party turns out to be a trap. Fujiko is taken hostage and Lupin, with a time-bomb belt strapped to his waist

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin is in Monaco to race his new toy in the Monaco Grand Prix. Or so he thought. Lupin ends up losing both his money and race car in a fixed poker game at the casino.
programme.sub-title: Bet on the Monaco Grand Prix!

programme.title: Robocop 3, (1993, Action)
programme.desc: In this second sequel to the 1987 hit, RoboCop leaves the force and joins the rebellion to battle the evil business corporation OCP, which uses a police-like group to remove the homeless people who populate the site of a future upscale development.

programme.title: Deep Impact, (1998, Science fiction)
programme.desc: When a couple of young astronomers discover an enormous comet on course to collide with Earth, the countdown to doomsday begins and the human race embarks on the fight for survival.

programme.title: Lifeforce, (1985, Sci-Fi Horror)
programme.desc: A frightening journey into the unknown awaits an Earthbound scout ship when it comes across an alien spacecraft of enormous proportions. Further investigation reveals a roomful of glass coffins containing the bodies of frozen creatures.

programme.title: The Core, (2003, Science fiction)
programme.desc: The Earth has stopped rotating because of a change in the planet's core temperature. To restore the normal temperature, astronauts must travel to the center and detonate a nuclear bomb before the core superheats and destroys all life on the surface.

programme.title: Deep Impact, (1998, Science fiction)
programme.desc: When a couple of young astronomers discover an enormous comet on course to collide with Earth, the countdown to doomsday begins and the human race embarks on the fight for survival.

programme.title: Robocop, (2014, Science fiction)
programme.desc: In 2028 Detroit, when Alex Murphy (Joel Kinnaman) -- a loving husband, father and good cop -- is critically injured in the line of duty, the multinational conglomerate OmniCorp sees their chance for a part-man, part-robot police officer.

programme.title: The Crow, (1994, Action)
programme.desc: Visually stunning and action-packed, this hit movie, based on the comic book series, follows the return from the grave of a young rock guitarist who, along with his fiance, is brutally killed by a ruthless gang of criminals.

programme.title: Warlock, (1959, Drama)
programme.desc: An ex-outlaw (Richard Widmark) divides and challenges a quick-draw lawman (Henry Fonda) and his sidekick (Anthony Quinn).

programme.title: My Pal Trigger, (1946, Drama)
programme.desc: Roy Rogers goes to jail after hes wrongly accused of killing Gabby Hayes horse in this action packed yarn from Republic Pictures.

programme.title: The Deadly Companions, (1962, Drama)
programme.desc: An ex-army officer accidentally kills a woman's son and tries to make up for it by escorting the funeral procession through dangerous Indian territory.

programme.title: Sioux City Sue, (1946, Drama)
programme.desc: A talent scout searches for a cowboy singer to do the voice for a cartoon character happens upon Gene Autry, who reluctantly takes the job, not knowing he is to be the voice of an animated donkey!

programme.title: The Big Sombrero, (1949, Drama)
programme.desc: Gene heads South in a fiesta of melody and a jamboree of romance. He fights for the right of rancheros to live on their rancho. Outlaws fear him and senoritas cheer him, and his famous horse Champion.

programme.title: The Dark Command, (1940, Drama)
programme.desc: A Civil War tale based on the exploits of the notorious outlaw William Quantrill. A courageous sheriff stands up to Quantrill and his band of guerrillas pillaging the countryside in Civil War-torn Kansas, and stops the raids.

programme.title: In Old California, (1942, Drama)
programme.desc: The Duke plays a young, ambitious pharmacist who moves into a brawling frontier town but locks horns with a local crime lord, bent on keeping the town for himself.

programme.title: The Hills Run Red, (1967, Drama)
programme.desc: A man recently released from a five-year prison sentence seeks vengeance against the former friend who has violated his trust and sought his death. Starring Thomas Hunter, Henry Silva, and Dan Duryea.

programme.title: Goin' South, (1978, Western)
programme.desc: JACK NICHOLSON plays Henry Moon, a third-rate outlaw, in this romantic comedy set in the 1860s.

programme.title: The White Buffalo, (1977, Drama)
programme.desc: Charles Bronson and Will Sampson star as Wild Bill Hickok and Chief Crazy Horse in this one-of-a-kind western that finds both western legends braving the snowy wilderness in search of the demon that haunts them both, the fabled White Buffalo!

programme.title: Lakeview Terrace, (2008, Thriller)
programme.desc: A young interracial couple move into their dream home and are increasingly harassed by their next-door neighbor, a tightly wound black LAPD officer. When the couple decides to fight back the feud turns deadly.

programme.title: World Trade Center, (2006, Drama)
programme.desc: Nicolas Cage and Michael Pea star as two New York City Port Authority policemen who were trapped in the rubble of September 11, 2001.

programme.title: Disturbia, (2007, Drama)
programme.desc: Living under three months' house arrest, Kale Brecht (Shia LaBeouf, Transformers) passes his days spying on the neighbors. It's all fun and games until things take a horrifying turn for the worse.

programme.title: Lakeview Terrace, (2008, Thriller)
programme.desc: A young interracial couple move into their dream home and are increasingly harassed by their next-door neighbor, a tightly wound black LAPD officer. When the couple decides to fight back the feud turns deadly.

programme.title: World Trade Center, (2006, Drama)
programme.desc: Nicolas Cage and Michael Pea star as two New York City Port Authority policemen who were trapped in the rubble of September 11, 2001.

programme.title: Disturbia, (2007, Drama)
programme.desc: Living under three months' house arrest, Kale Brecht (Shia LaBeouf, Transformers) passes his days spying on the neighbors. It's all fun and games until things take a horrifying turn for the worse.

programme.title: Saving Silverman, (2001, Comedy)
programme.desc: Darren, Wayne and J.D. have been inseparable since grade school. However, their friendship is put to the test when Darren meets Judith, a young lady with the looks of an angel and the demeanor of the devil himself.

programme.title: The Longest Yard, (2005, Comedy)
programme.desc: The story of a pro quarterback and former college champion and coach are asked to put together a football team of inmates to take on the guards while doing their time in prison.

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: The Dark Gate opens, and Dark Energy spreads everywhere. To stop this, the Sailor Guardians must defeat Black Lady.

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: Taking Tuxedo Mask as a hostage, Kaolinite tells Usagi and the Sailor Guardians to come to the top of Tokyo Tower for their final showdown.

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: Following Kaolinites death, Eudial takes over and begins searching for the talismans. Her first target is Maya, a world-renowned Taiko drummer.

programme.title: Sailor Moon
programme.desc: Chibi-Usa has returned from the future to complete her training as a Sailor Guardian. She is to learn how to make friends in the twentieth century.

programme.title: Sailor Moon

programme.sub-title: Amanojaku: Tonight, the Spirits Will be Resurrected!

programme.title: Ghost Stories

programme.sub-title: Akagami Aogami: A Hand Reaches Out from the Toilet...

programme.title: Ghost Stories
programme.desc: The big play is coming up, but the boy in the lead role is scared. He makes a wish for the gymnasium to catch fire--and it does. Then, when the play moves to being held in the old schoolhouse, the boy wishes to be injured--and he is!
programme.sub-title: The Curtain is Raised! The Cursed School Fine Arts Festival...
